alert.note: Alert for Clinton; Greene; Warren (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 8:57AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHEASTERN WARREN, NORTHWESTERN CLINTON AND SOUTHWESTERN GREENE COUNTIES THROUGH 930 AM EDT... At 857 AM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near Waynesville, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds gusts up to 35 mph, pea size hail, and frequent cloud-to-ground lightning. SOURCE...Public. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Lightning can cause serious injury or death. Locations impacted include... Wilmington, Waynesville, Clarksville, Harveysburg, Martinsville, Corwin, Midland, Melvin, New Antioch, Mount Holly, Roxanna, Oakland, Cuba, Reesville, State Route 350 at US Route 22, Caesar Creek State Park, Morrisville, Ogden, Kingman and Burtonville. This includes I-71 in Ohio between mile markers 38 and 53. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...35 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. When thunder roars, go indoors! Do not stay in the open or seek shelter under trees when lightning threatens. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
